definition: to make a pun/to have a double meaning/double entendre
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

sentences.english: Most of the comedians jokes involved a play on words.
sentences.chinese: 喜劇演員的笑話大多是一語雙關。

sentences.english: The slogan is a pun on the name of the product.
sentences.chinese: 那廣告用語與其產品名稱一語雙關。

sentences.english: Much British humour depends on ambiguity.
sentences.chinese: 英國幽默有很多是靠一語雙關而得。

sentences.english: A pass, the idea of menace finishes now.
sentences.chinese: 一語雙關，威脅之意畢現。

sentences.english: Some sort of pun on the word 'tracks' may be intended.
sentences.chinese: 可能作者一語雙關，用火車暗指“軌跡”。
